S5.T1.caption: Table 1: Sample sizes of AA and EA populations across seven sites.

Site Name N # of EA # of AA
Geisinger Health System 3090 3081 9
Group Health Cooperative 278 262 16
Marshfield Clinic 3980 3977 3

Northwestern University 1524 1223 301
Vanderbilt University 4226 2580 1646
references:
Table 1 shows the characteristics of the samples by site. We observe that participants from Geisinger, Group Health, Marshfield and Mayo are mostly from EA population, while less than 20 subjects are from AA population. Since the sample size less than 20 may cause potential issues for privacy protection, we exclude the AA samples from Geisinger, Group Health, Marshfield and Mayo. The three sites with substantial numbers of AA samples are Mount Sinai, Northwestern, and Vanderbilt. In our analysis, we choose Northwestern as an external testing dataset, where we do not included it in the model training. In addition, we randomly select 300300300 African American samples from Vanderbilt and Northwestern, respectively, for internal testing. We filtered the single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) based on Hardy–Weinberg equilibrium, missing proportion, minor allele frequency, LD pruning, and marginal effect sizes obtained from an external large GWAS (Morris
et al., 2012). The detailed filtering parameters can be found in the Supplementary Material. A total of 201720172017 SNPs passed the filtering process and are included in the prediction model.
